projects.description: This project features a simple application that displays a random quote each time a button is clicked. I created an array of quotes from notable figures and wrote functions to select and display them. This helped me practice basic JavaScript concepts like arrays and functions.

In this project, I implemented pagination for a student list that starts with 42 entries. Using JavaScript, I enabled the display of nine students per page, adding navigation for users to browse through the entire list. This ensures adaptability for any number of student records.

For this project, I enhanced a registration form for a fictional Full Stack conference by adding JavaScript functionality. I focused on input validation and interactive feedback, helping users identify errors in real-time. This made the form more user-friendly and efficient.

I developed a word guessing game named "Phrase Hunter," where users try to guess a hidden phrase by clicking on letters. This project utilized Object-Oriented Programming principles, allowing me to create an engaging and interactive experience for players.

In this project, I built an employee directory for a fictional company called Awesome Startup, using the Random User Generator API. The application pulls data for 12 employees, displaying their details in a grid format with additional info available in a modal. This showcases my ability to work with APIs and manage asynchronous data effectively.
